intro: Dissochaeta brachyanthera, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has linear, hairy leaves and produces white or pale blue flowers that bloom in spring. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with deep roots and a low water requirement. Dissochaeta brachyanthera is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of local flora in its native habitat.
